intro: Neolloydia schmiedickeana var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender neolloydia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
